statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Appalachian State 56, The Citadel 52
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Jeremy Clayton scored 14 points and had 10 rebounds to help Appalachian State rally to a 56-52 win over The Citadel on Monday night. The Mountaineers (5-2, 2-0 Southern Conference) trailed 44-28 with 14 minutes to go, but scored 13 points in a row during a 24-2 run over the next seven minutes to take a 48-46 lead. With the game tied at 52 with 16 seconds left, Doug McLaughlin-Williams went to the line for Appalachian State, making the first free throw and missing the second. D.J. Thompson ran the offensive rebound down and hit one of two foul shots to give the Mountaineers a 54-52 lead. The Citadel's J'Mel Everhart was fouled and missed the front end of a one-and-one. Demetrious Nelson was then fouled trying to get the rebound for The Citadel (2-8, 0-1 SoCon), but missed both free throws. Appalachian State's Nathan Cranford then hit two more free throws to seal the win. The Bulldogs shot just 2-for-9 from the foul line, while the Mountaineers made 11 of their 16 free throws. Everhart led The Citadel with 13 points, while Nelson added 12. McLaughlin-Williams scored nine points and Thompson and Cranford each added eight for Appalachian State.
